batchConfirm(uint256[]).notice: Confirm multiple proposals in one transaction (danger: unbounded loop)

batchExecute(uint256[]).notice: Batch execute many proposals (gas exhaustion danger)

batchPropose(address[],uint256[],bytes[].notice: Create many proposals in one transaction (danger: unbounded loop)

emergencyWithdraw(address).notice: Emergency withdraw that can be time-manipulated (timestamp dependence)

executeWithSignature(address,uint256,byt.notice: Execute a single transaction authorized by an off-chain signature. This intentionally demonstrates a naive, vulnerable signature flow:  - no nonce included (T-02)  - no domain separator / chainId / contract binding (T-02)  - simple signature on (to,value,keccak(data))  naive packing (T-12)
